event.name: NEBULA_LEECH_PSA
event.text: A nearby Leech medical outpost hails you. Looks like they have some important message to relay.

"Mental health is no laughing matter. Depression can be tough to go through, but just remember that you aren't alone. No matter where you are in life, you can't give up. Your family and friends are here for you. If you or a loved one is struggling with depression or suicidal thoughts, seek help and don't let it go untreated."

You wait for some dramatic twist or punchline, but nothing comes. Turns out, mental health is serious business. The Leeches offer you some scrap as thanks for listening, and hope you'll take this advice to heart.

choice.text: (Clone Bay) Point out that you force your crew to commit suicide all the time.

event.text: It seems your insensitive comments do not have a positive impact on the Leeches, who in their outrage fire upon your ship. Perhaps this was not a good idea.
Important message, important shmessage. It probably isn't that important enough for you to care.

event.name: NEBULA_LEECH_CREW
event.text: A large Leech carrier, no doubt a remnant of those fabled "glory days" looms in the distance. As you approach, a shuttle detaches from the ship and glides carefully through the asteroids towards you.
"Please help! I have been drafted into the military, but I know it is nothing but a death sentence. I still have my whole life ahead of me! Please take me with you!"
The Leech apparently won't take no for an answer. After a few more refusals and insults he eventually turns hostile and attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_LEECH_AMPERE_CONVERSION
event.text: There's a terminal at this beacon advertising a nearby planet with an Ampere Conversion Chamber - a Coalition-run place that can fast-track Leeches to Amperes, for a price.

choice.text: (Leech Crew) Send your Leech onto a shuttle.

event.text: The Leech secretary at the station seems very unengaged. "The fee is 30 scrap. There is no painkillers and we're not liable for long term side-effects."

Your Leech is covered end to end with electrodes and given an IV. They hesitantly enter the conversion chamber. After several minutes of sustained screaming, the sounds of electrical zapping and the faint smell of burning Leeches, your new Ampere crew stumbles out of the chamber. Aside from the pain, they seem to be no worse for wear.
Your crew returns to the ship, unchanged.

Tyrdeo hails the center. "Hello. It's your president. I'm leaving the sector to travel the galaxy, and I would like some backup. Is there any of you who will come with me?" The center sends you an Ampere right away who seems enthusiastic at the opportunity to travel out of Leech space.
You shouldn't risk contact with them unless you have a Leech, anyway.

textList.name: TEXT_LEECH_SPACE_TRASH
textList.text: It's only here in Leech space that you could expect to find immense volumes of garbage littering the cosmos. This beacon is abandoned save for all of the trash, so perhaps you could take advantage of it?

Several large chunks of debris almost collide with your ship, but fortunately you're able to swerve out of the way. Looks like the nearby region is littered with space trash left behind by the Leeches.
A black bag filled with toiletries and used food wrappers splatters on your windshield. Disgusting, but it looks like the rings of garbage all around this system might contain some hidden treasures.

choice.text: Do something else aboard the ship.

event.text: You've decided to use this beacon for a short reprieve instead.
Looks like most of the trash is just scrap, except for a few fuel cells that must have been discarded on accident.
Most of the stuff is worthless, save for what looks to be a weapon! It's old and rusty, but a gun is a gun, and you aren't complaining!
Looks like all the trash field has to offer is some measly scrap. Nevertheless, it's still something.

event.name: LEECH_MISSION
event.text: Looks like a Chrysolic mission has been established nearby by the Theocracy. The permission to build these outposts was part of their trade to support the president against the revolution. It seems even the Inquisition couldn't stop the insurrection, but nevertheless these missions are littered around Leech space.

The moment you step aboard, you're greeted by the unpleasant musk of unbathed Rock clergymen and Leech bile. You manage to supress the vomit rising in your throat, but catch a few strange looks from the residents.

choice.text: Purchase a Crystal weapon from their shrine.

event.text: You honestly didn't expect the Rockmen to part so easily with their prized Crystal tech, but apparently money surpasses all else.

choice.text: Recruit one of the clergy to work aboard your ship.

event.text: Most of the Rockmen scoff at your offer, but one of the younger priests seems more than eager to go with you. Once on your ship, he attributes his quick change of heart to the smell.
The spiritual always seem to provide help for those of their own kind, though you don't suppose they would be so generous if your Rockman revealed he no longer served the Theocracy.

choice.text: Leave before the stench kills you.

event.text: You draw your weapons and engage.
The Theocracy isn't exactly friends with the Federation, and you can never know how their clergy might respond to your presence.

event.name: LEECH_MINERS
event.text: The dense asteroid field here seems to have another secret - a large Leech settlement embedded in one of the larger asteroids. It's camouflaged well, which suggests they don't want to be found.
Whatever this settlement has to offer isn't worth enduring the already present asteroid hazard. You prepare the next jump.
As it turns out, the settlement's defenses are a lot weaker than you first expected. They barely make an effort to fight back - instead handing over some supplies.
As it turns out, the settlement's defenses are a lot weaker than you first expected. They barely make an effort to fight back - instead handing over some supplies.
In response to your attack approach, the settlement has dispatched a ship to retaliate!
The settlement ignores your repeated hails. You suppose that's a sign not to linger any longer.
It appears the settlement is low on resources, having been forgotten thanks to their excellent camouflage. They offer to trade.
The settlement is friendlier than you expected. They promise to help with the Rebel fleet once they pass through this stretch of space.

event.name: NEBULA_LEECH_GARDEN
event.text: Despite the nebula all around, a small Vampweed outpost is nearby. It's no military base either - the station's massive biodome seems to contain a variety of flora.

The minute you approach the outpost, a Vampweed ship detaches and attacks! You know they can be territorial, but this is quite an extreme reaction! Maybe you can reason with these guys after roughing them up a bit.

choice.text: (Vampweed Crew) Request access to the outpost.

event.text: It might be a stunning garden for sure, but make no mistake that the Vampweeds are your ally. If they have any reason to attack you, chances are they will.

event.name: LEECH_GARDEN_VISIT
event.text: The Vampweeds welcome you aboard the station. They offer you some fuel cells for showing so much interest in their garden.

choice.text: Buy one of their Spore weapons.

event.name: LEECH_TAVERN
event.text: Though the nebulas in this sector are sparsely spread out, it's nevertheless nice to see a complete clearing. Looks like many travelers must agree, because a busy tavern has been established nearby.

Several air fresheners hang from the ceiling, and the faint stains of alien blood decorate the crimson walls. You spot several familiar faces of other Multiverse Renegades, but your attention is stolen away by two drunken Leeches arguing with each other over the state of the Eargen Republic. Judging from their slang, one appears to be a loyalist, and the other a revolutionary.

The revolutionaries are outraged. "You have no place in this, Federation captain! These morons support a leader so incompetent he gave the corpses of dead children to the admiral of one of the strongest military powers as part of a show of 'peace'!" Furious, a band of fellow revolutionary Leeches gather and attack your ship!

The loyalists are outraged. "So the Federation's decided to support these morons? Don't you realize this revolution is only going to perpetuate the same miserable cycle we've been stuck in for centuries?" Furious, a band of fellow loyalist Leeches gather and attack your ship!

choice.text: Don't get in involved, stay and chat instead.

event.text: These morons can argue all they want. You leave them to their devices and go sit down with the friendly faces from earlier, and soon the conversation turns to talk of trading.
No need to go visiting random taverns. Place probably smells like hell too if it's full of Leeches.

event.name: LEECH_COALITION_FEDUP
event.text: A Coalition ship hails you from nearby. At first you're hesitant of a trick, but they seem to genuinely want to talk. "I can't take it, I can't take it, I jusssst can't TAKE IT! Thesssse Leechesss are driving me mad! I could be in sssome cussshy job blowing up orphanagessss, but apparently Leechesss don't even HAVE orphanagesss! They've already blown them all up! What good isss there when I can't sssenssslesssly murder children?!"

"Yeah yeah yeah, whatever. Point issss, I need to let off ssssome sssteam. But I can't go killing Leechessss myssself, got one of thosssse wormsss working on my ssship giving me weird looksss while I tell you all thissss. Ssso go blow up sssome Leechessss. I don't care who. Better yet, if you find a not-blown-up orphanage, go blow it up!"
This'll make a good target. Hopefully the Coalition will be satisfied with this kill.
This'll make a good target. Hopefully the Coalition will be satisfied with this kill.
This'll make a good target. Hopefully the Coalition will be satisfied with this kill.

choice.text: (Leech Crew) Your Leech knows the location of the nearest standing orphanage.

event.text: Your Leech leads you to the location of one the last few standing orphanages. They seem surprisingly okay with the notion of destroying it, so you hesitate no longer to burn it to the ground. The Coalition captain launches into a fit of uncontrollable laughter.

"You actually did it? Ohhhh man, that felt sssso good to watch. I think I peed a little... or at leasssst I hope that'sss pee. Doesn't matter. You are an elite sssslayer of Leechesss! I think I will come with you in hopesss we can do thisss more often..."
"Losssser."

choice.text: Wait, did you say you're killing children?

event.text: "Oh crap, forgot you were a Fed. Oh well, guessss I can take sssolace in blowing you up. Jusssst pretend you're an orphan, alright?"

choice.text: Mute the ship and fly away.

event.text: Apparently the Slug is so caught up in his ranting he doesn't even notice you flying away.

event.name: NEBULA_LEECH_SUICIDEMOON
event.text: Leave it to a Slug to take advantage of the vulnerable. A nearby Slug is charging Leech ships for the "privilege" of letting go and crashing on the nearby moon. A queue longer than you can see from this position awaits their turn.
"Oh pleasssse. If it weren't for me, they'd go kill themssselvessss sssomeplacce elssse. At leassst I get a profit off of it and they get what they want anywayssss!"
You power the weapons and attack the Slug ship.

choice.text: Pay the fee to obliterate you and your ship violently.

event.text: The Slug greedily scoops up your scrap and grants you permission to power off your engines. You do so, allowing your ship to plummet to the ground below. You're killed before you can even hear the chaotic explosion of your ship being torn to little bits.
This "business" is disgusting, but it's also none of your business either. If these Leeches want to go end their lives on that rock, then let them.

event.name: LEECH_SUICIDEMOON_WIN
event.text: The Leeches in line appear to be furious with your intervention. "Hey! Where are we supposed to go to kill ourselves now?!"

"I-I... wow, I never thought of that." The Leeches nod in agreeance about your wisdom. Unfortunately, they don't offer you anything in return. Sometimes, picking the morally correct option just doesn't pay...

choice.text: Take charge of the queue now that the Slug is dead.

event.text: You swap places with the now-dead Slug and continue to charge the Leeches for entry. You don't last very long until you have to step down, utterly disgusted by what you just did.

event.name: NEBULA_LEECH_LITTERING
event.text: The nearby Leech ship looks to be dumping out several lumpy black bags from their airlocks near a trash ring. Must be another lazy do-nothing who can't be bothered to recycle.

choice.text: Hey! Stop that! Littering is bad!

event.text: The Leech captain looks at you, bewildered. "H-huh? Uhhh yes, littering. I do apologize. Uh... yeah..."

choice.text: Offer to pick it up for them.

event.text: "O-oh that won't be necessary... Er, actually. You know what, go ahead." The Leech ship quickly jumps away.

choice.text: Demand they pick it up themselves.

event.text: The Leech ship panicks, frightened by the responsibility now placed on them. They power up their weapons!

"Okay, okay. You know what, we're sorry, we're sorry. Please just stop talking to us. You're the police or something? You know we gotta dispose of these bodies somehow! Oh... I said too much..." The Leeches offer you a bribe if you don't tell anyone what they're up to. Your Orchid disapproves, but what are they going to do about it?
Littering is despicable, but you aren't willing to say anything about it. Way to contribute to the problem...

event.name: LEECH_LITTERING_WIN
event.text: You float closer to the black bags, and scoop them up into the ship. However, they're oddly... squishy. Pulling open the bag reveals a revolting sight of dismembered Leech organs, recently cut apart. Looks like these guys were trying to hide the evidence!
It's repulsive to think about and probably not all that ethically clean, but you aren't one to pass up such an opportunity.

choice.text: Toss the body parts back into the void.
(Clone Bay) Collect some DNA swabs and clone them.

event.text: The frightened and most certainly traumatized Leech that emerges from your Clone Bay proceeds to panic, and demands to know who you are. Once you've explained the situation, they calm down and agree to work. Probably because they're afraid you'll kill them too.

event.name: DISTRESS_LEECH_CARGO_LOST
event.text: There's a big mess in this asteroid field, with a lot of boxes floating in space. A Leech ship presumably involved with this hails. "We're in some pretty deep doodoo here. My cargo bay wasn't locked down properly and it came open at the worst time. You gotta help us!"

choice.text: (Magnetic Arm) Help the Leeches collect their strewn cargo.

event.text: Your Magnetic Arm is easily able to collect the cargo and direct it back into their bay. There is much relief amongst the Leeches. "Oh joyous day! Our stuff! For your aid, we'll give you a little reward. Out of all the races in this galaxy, our people are the ones who deal the most with asteroid fields, so we know a thing or two about autopilots. We can upgrade yours!"

choice.text: Take some time to help the Leeches collect their strewn cargo.

event.text: It takes quite some time to collect the lost cargo. Unfortunately, it's so time consuming that the Rebel fleet is able to gain on your position. The Leeches also seem to be somewhat impatient. "This will have to do... though it would have taken much longer without your help. For your aid, please take this reward. Out of all the races in this galaxy, our people are the ones who deal the most with asteroid fields, so we know a thing or two about autopilots. We can upgrade yours!"
You're not interested in helping them sort their problems out. In fact, you might just cause a few more for them.

choice.text: Focus on escaping the asteroid field.

event.text: You devote your energy to piloting away from the asteroids.

event.name: DISTRESS_LEECH_ETERNAL_COMATOSE
event.text: A small Republic colony is sending out a distress signal. "Something awful is happening... People are going to sleep and just... not waking up. Even the Clone Bay doesn't fix it. If you have any medical knowhow, please help us out."

After you dock with the colony, Anurak starts working. "Ah, yes! Your spiritual journeys have taken you down a dark and poorly lit path. No wonder you all keep dosing off!" Anurak begins to mix up his remedy. Tossing in some herbs, he grinds his remedy into a fine paste and begins to smear it onto their faces. The patient begins to stir. "You all need something to look forward to!" Anurak scribbles some notes onto a piece of paper and foists it into the hands of the Leech who contacted you.

choice.text: (Alkali) Have Alkali figure out what's going on.

event.text: After you dock with the colony, Alkali begins examining the patients. "My first guess is a lack of proper nutrition, perhaps compounded by a small illness and low morale." Alkali begins to set up vitamin shots for some of the patients. "Thhhere's somethhhhing wrong withhhh your food. If you get thhhhat sorted, thhhhat should be thhhhe end of it."

Your medic goes down to the colony and begins to check on the patients. After running a few tests, the medic determines that their food source is contaminated. While this alone wasn't enough, they then contracted a Leech illness that caused them to fall asleep with no hope of recovering. Your medic begins to feed the patients some vitamins, and that begins to rouse them, though they still may take a bit to wake up.

Your Shell goes down to the colony. After some tests, they determine that an illness the Leeches contracted caused them to lose consciousness, and without proper nutrition, they had no way of reviving. Since the Leeches are eating, the conclusion your scientist comes to is that their food source is contaminated. They prescribe vitamin tablets to all the afflicted and return to your ship.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Examine them in your upgraded Medbay.

event.text: You accept some of the patients into your Medbay. Your advanced medical systems are able to flood their systems with nutrients and causes all of them to stir. Your medical bay reports that they were suffering from a somewhat common Leech illness, and had near total malnutrition. You tell them that they may want to examine the food they've been eating.

choice.text: (Quarp Juice) Give them something that will put some pep in their step.

event.text: You give the patients some of your Quarp Juice. After a few moments they jolt awake, practically bouncing off the walls. They still don't look well, but they start thanking you with a crazed mania atypical of their species.
The Leech in charge of the distress call looks concerned. "Are you sure that stuff is healthy...? Oh well. At least they're up and about again." The Leeches give you a gift for your assistance.
You have some free time to spend doing something else.

event.name: LEECH_COMATOSE_COLONY_GRATEFUL
event.text: The Leeches thank you profusely. "Thank you so much... we didn't know why a common sickness would put us to sleep like that. What could have happened to our food? We will have to look into it. In the meantime, please accept this gift."

event.name: DISTRESS_LEECH_GRAPHITI
event.text: Through the asteroid field here, you're surprised to find a Federation vessel, covered in heavy graffiti! They hail. "A band of pesky teenaged Leech delinquents came by, drew all kinds of nasty things on our ship, stole our cargo, called me some horrid name. It sounded like they said 'boomer', whatever that means. Could you be a pal and go get back our cargo?"
You follow the Fed ship's directions until you find a small Leech shuttle with 3 or so Leeches inside. As soon as you approach, they start laughing at you and shouting various uncreative insults.

choice.text: Send a little warning shot to scare them.

event.text: You lock the weapons onto one of the passing asteroids near the shuttle. The explosion doesn't seem to frigthen the adolescents, but rather seems to egg them on. "Hey old man! Keep that up, and I'm gonna call my dad on you!"

"Hey! I said not to do that! Alright, now you're in for it!" You detect a distress signal being broadcast from the shuttle, and moments later an Ampere ship jumps in. "You been touching my son? I'm going to carve out your skull and use it to drink my regurgitated bile!"
"Hah! No! What're you going to do, tell my dad or somethin?"
"Wait crap, please don't! He'll be super mad! I'll kill you!" The Leech ship attacks!

The Leech struggles for a few moments, the uncontained power of teenaged angst rivaling that of one of the most sophisticated manipulative technologies in the galaxy. Inevitably, he gives in. "I think I will give you the cargo. And, I will learn to respect my elders."

choice.text: Bring the cargo back to the Fed ship.
(Upg. Weapons) Pull a trick shot and start blasting up all the asteroids.

event.text: Losing all self control and embracing your inner wild-side, you spin the ship around in circles, blasting up countless hundreds of asteroids. The Leeches are not longer quite so unfazed. "Dude, I think this guy is a psychopath. What the actual hell even WAS that?" The Leeches hand over the cargo, afraid you might snap at any moment and kill them too.

choice.text: Bring the cargo back to the Fed ship.

event.text: You aren't an errand-man. They might not have their cargo, but this ship is more than capable of handling some teenagers.

event.name: LEECH_GRAPHITI_RETURN
event.text: "Oh thank Newton. That'll show those brats not to deface government property."

event.name: NEBULA_LEECH_DELEGATE
event.text: It appears you're receiving a long ranged transmission with Zoltan encoding, marked as urgent. To the Zoltans, all matters are 'urgent', but it still might require your attention.

"Before the time of the current president, Tyrdeo, the Eargen president Oertiss led an unsuccessful invasion against Zoltan space. His leadership was cut short when his soon to be successor Aerkae led a siege on Oertiss' palace and hacked him into tiny bits which were embalmed and kept as trophies."

choice.text: Cool history lesson, but why are you telling us this?

event.text: "Have patience. The Ministry was satisfied with Aerkae's appointment, but to prevent future attacks it was agreed upon that the Ministry may install up to 3 embassies within Leech territory that would also serve to ensure further... incidents would not occur. This has been upheld by all subsequent Leech presidents until now. Under Tyrdeo's leadership, it seems he has become so overwhelmed with the current revolution, he has turned ignorant to the effects of the Inquisition and furthermore the Coalition being allowed in his territory."

choice.text: Please, just get to the point.

event.text: "We are nearly there. As the Ministry supports the Federation, it is within the Coalition's best interests to prevent Federation and therefore also Ministry intervention in conflicts involving them. They appear to be afraid to take action directly however, and thus have hired the Tiiikaka slaver clan to enslave our delegates and ship them off to other stretches of the galaxy. As a Federation ship, we request that you travel to these co-ordinates and put an end to this." The Zoltan hang up without so much as a please or thank you.
The Zoltans can deal with their own problems. Traveling through Leech space is dangerous enough.

event.name: LEECH_DELEGATE_CAMP

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Ministry embassy is under siege by Tiiikaka raiders.

event.text: As warned, a band of Tiiikaka pirates have taken control of the embassy at the given coordinates, and are rounding up the Zoltan officials and taking inventory.
You've seen enough - time to put a stop to this!
Apparently, the slavers weren't prepared to see a well armed Federation ship out here. They quickly hurry back to their ship and take off.

choice.text: Purchase one of the Zoltan slaves.

event.text: The slavers are startled by your sudden appearance, but once they realize your offer is in earnest, they quickly go along with it.
It's risky getting involved with slavers. Tiiikaka isn't known for showing mercy, and you don't want to get caught on their bad side.

event.name: LEECH_DELEGATE_CAMP_WIN
event.text: The Zoltans are shaken, but alright. Not long after, a Zoltan war vessel armed to the teeth jumps in, and you recognize the voice as the same one from earlier. The Zoltans introduce themselves with a brief "We'll take it from here", then begin reorganizing the embassy. Again, you receive no thanks, but you do at least talk them into giving you a reward.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_LEECH
textList.text: Leeches might be depressive and unmotivated, but not even that can get in the way of their arrogance. Some high and mighty Leech soldier apparently thinks he can take you on and attacks!

The unpredictable strategies employed by the incompetent and usually only half-willing modern Eargen military can make Leech ships frightening adversaries. Let's hope you can make it out of this one without too many scratches!

A Leech captain of the nearby ship hails you and clears his throat. "Ah crap, I had something I was gonna say. Awkward... uh, I'm just going to kill you. But it was going to sound WAY cooler if I had remembered my original speech."

Judging alone from the drunken movements of the nearby Leech ship, you suspect their captain isn't all there at the moment. In his stupor, he mistakes you for an enemy and attacks! Looks like you won't be able to reason with this one.
Hard to say why the nearby Leech ship has chosen to attack you. A death wish perhaps? You wouldn't be surprised, but you would have preferred if they had just asked instead of forcing it upon you!
A Leech ship eyes you passing by, and orders you to stop. Apparently, he's one of the last few soldiers left with the motivation to actually uphold his post. It's a shame his effort is wasted on you!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_LEECH_PULSAR
event.text: Though this forsaken sector might be mostly asteroid fields and nebulas, apparently a pulsar has found its lovely way here to bother you some more, while a Leech ship locks on and attacks!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REVOLUTIONARY
textList.text: It sure seems as if nearly every government nowadays is in the midst of rebellion, including the Leeches. A revolutionary vessel, dangerously low on fuel, decides to attack you for all that you've got!
A nearby revolutionary ship accuses you of supporting President Tyrdeo and attacks before you can defend yourself!
As with many insurrections, it appears the Leech revolutionaries are violent and aggressive nationalists who'll attack anyone, even passing Federation ships like you with no word in the matter!

The Leech revolutionaries themselves probably wouldn't mind the Federation so much if it weren't for the Vampweeds assisting them. The Vampweeds technically aren't your enemies - but with their nation being so inclined towards militarization, and the fact they fought on the side of the Hive in the Federation-Mantis war means they aren't so hesitant to taking on Federation ships in their space!

"The future is now! First the Eargen Republic, then the galaxy, then the Multiverse! The Leeches shall taste glory once again!" These revolutionaries seem to be setting their sights a bit too high, but you won't waste time talking it through.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_LEECH_ROCK
textList.text: The Inquisition made a deal with Tyrdeo to protect Eargen space from the revolutionaries, but so far they've mostly just established immense numbers of troops here that do little to actually help the government, and more to just bother travelers like you. Whoopee!
A Rock captain stares down your ship. "I am tired of working with these repulsive tapeworms. I will escape, using your ship."
It's a miracle the Rockmen can tolerate being around the Leeches when they're normally so prudish. It's clearly putting them on edge, enough so that with little reason the Rock ship here attacks!

"These Leeches know nothing of the holy words! I am tired, and frustrated. The Theocracy will not let us leave until the war is over. I will now pretend you are my coworkers, and I will smash you into bits."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_LEECH_COALITION
textList.text: The introduction of the Leeches into the Coalition seems to have been only a half-hearted gesture on both sides. The Republic doesn't seem all too keen on acting in the interest of the Coalition, and it's highly probable the Coalition is only helping fight the revolutionaries because of the number of soldiers the Leeches can provide. Now, enough politics. A threat approaches!

For all the Coalition's build up as some grand galactic threat, they really haven't seemed to do much besides the Aquarian Invasions. Sure, it's a nuisance you have to deal with ships like the one barreling towards you right now, but at least they aren't directly attacking the Federation anymore.
"Geh, you know what's worse than a stupid smelly Leech? A stupider, smellier Federation captain!" The Coalition captain receives several high-fives from his crew, then attacks!
A Coalition ship looms, unsure whether it will attack you. That's a joke of course - they already made up in their minds to attack before you'd even had the time to read the first sentence.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_LEECH_VAMPWEED
event.text: According to the stories, Tyrdeo pissed off the Vampweed Premier so much by handing him a handpicked bouquet of flowers during a diplomatic meeting, that he outright declared war on their entire species. Hilarious story yes, but unfortunately the Vampweeds are the exact opposite of their Floral brethren and aren't quite so hesitant to attack passerbys like yourself!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_LEECH_ELITE
event.text: Though most of the Eargen military has fallen behind, the Amperes have remained a major threat thanks to the Coalition's support. While a majority of the Ampere forces are dedicated to helping in Coalition efforts, many still remain in Leech space to fight off threats. Threats like you, apparently.

destroyed.text: The Ampere vessel has been defeated.

deadCrew.text: The Ampere vessel has been defeated.

event.name: ALKRAM_MEET
event.text: Curiously, a fleet of Eargen ships have congregated here as they're fired upon by revolutionary vessels. It's an unfortunate skirmish to get caught in, until you spot an unusually decorated craft flying among the ships.

The strange vessel seems to be a battleship of some sort, bearing the paint of a Leech general. You can't look at it for long however, because an Ampere vessel has spotted you and assumes you're hostile!
It's far too risky to get any closer to the conflict. You put as much distance from yourself to the other fleet ships as possible.

event.name: ALKRAM_MEET_WIN
event.text: With the ship out of the way, you turn your attention back to the strange Leech ship, but see it has slinked away from the combat. It's heavily damaged, and the interior view shows wounded soldiers and one heavily armored Leech wiping blood off of his teeth using his tail.

"So, you've come to kill us? Another one of Tyrdeo's pawns. Do what you may, but know that the Republic will fall. I have put into motion things you cannot undo by simply killing me. Cut off a Leech's head, and it'll only grow back stronger!"

choice.text: We have no idea who you are.

event.text: The Leech pauses, and his two eye slits squint tighter than normal. "You look too high standing to be an agent of that purple parasite. My introduction is irrelevant, so I will spare you the details. I am Alkram Tripae, former general of the Eargen Republic under leadership of President Oertiss during the Federation-Mantis War. Now, in my old age, I have taken to ensuring the stability of the crown by ridding it of its current incompetency."

choice.text: Crown? I thought Tyrdeo was president.

event.text: "Exactly my point. That exuberant, dimwitted moron carries with him a shiny golden crown and fancies himself king, yet he has done nothing but lead our kind into even greater turmoil. If you do not fight for Tyrdeo, and are most certainly not of the Rebellion, then I figure you must be Federation in some respect. This skirmish is only a minor one - soon, we will reconvene at Tyrdeo's mansion where he is hiding, and seize the Republic. If you stand for the same liberties as the Federation claims then I hope you will join us." Alkram transfers over some coordinates and immediately goes back to focusing on his crew.
You have no idea who this Leech is or why Tyrdeo wants him dead, but hell if you don't enjoy some senseless murder.

choice.text: Ignore the ship and carry on your way.

destroyed.text: The mighty vessel has been defeated - not even the strongest ship in the Eargen military could withstand your power.

deadCrew.text: The mighty vessel has been defeated - not even the strongest ship in the Eargen military could withstand your power.

event.name: TYRDEO_PALACE

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This is the location Alkram described for certain - it's impossible to mistake the giant palace with its blinding beacon of light. With how run down the rest of Leech space is, it seems impossible something so well constructed could be here, but then again if it wasn't maybe the place wouldn't be the way it is.

A fleet of revolutionary vessels have gathered around the palace, matched in equal force by the few remaining Eargen loyalists, as well as Inquisition and Coalition vessels. No one's managed to breach the mansion's security, and you can see why. A massive Ampere Dreadnaught protects the barrier around the structure, and it's no small threat. When you hear the stories of ancient massive Leech vessels, this is what they're talking about.
The massive war vessel lurches towards you as you approach. Time to put the myths to the test.
Liberty and all that jazz is cool, but you'd rather live to see tomorrow than die supporting a conflict you have no personal stake in.

event.name: TYRDEO_PALACE_ENTER
event.text: With the Dreadnaught downed, the barrier falls in a matter of minutes and revolutionaries swarm the palace grounds. In the heat of the conflict you manage to slip past the rest of the defenses and enter the mansion.

Few guards remain inside, all occupied handling the invaders on the exterior. You manage to break your way into Tyrdeo's bedchambers where you see the sickly purple worm nervously watching the conflict from his window. This is Tyrdeo.

The Leech turns around, frightened. His wavering voice is surprisingly soft, like a child rather than a dictator. "Oh heavens! Please, have mercy. Oh dear oh dear. What have I done? Has it really come to this? A foreign hitman breaking down my door, cutting my head off upon my own bed? Please, do it quick, and don't hurt my Wealsey." Tyrdeo points with one of his tongues to a cage in the corner of the room with contains a large, bright yellow avian creature, who chirps cheerfully despite the dire mood of the room.

choice.text: We aren't hitmen - you'll answer for your crimes in front of your people.

event.text: "No-no please! Please! I don't care if you kill me, but if you hand me over to them you have no idea what they're going to do to me! They'll hack me into bits like Oertiss, or cut my tongue off and strangle me with it like Aerkae! Just shoot me, please!" Tyrdeo crumples to the ground, sobbing uncontrollably. You sling him over your shoulder and haul him over to Alkram, who has arrived at the palace as well and thanks you. "We found a cruiser in one of the hangars, seems to have been Tyrdeo's private cruiser and his escape plan. He has no use for it anymore, so we'll give it to the Federation as a gift."

Tyrdeo is dragged out to the courtyard where you see most of the fighting has already stopped. Seeing the president captured, the last of the loyalists surrender. Tyrdeo is strung up in front of the crowd of jeering Leeches as he continues to sob. Even some of the Coalition and Inquisition officers join in. Tyrdeo pleads, "Heavens, is this really necessary? You were the ones that put me in charge, I only tried to help!" Tyrdeo lets out a giant sob. "I know it was stupid to give the Vampweeds flowers, but I was only trying to make friends! Joining the Coalition seemed the best way to stabilize the nation! What was I to do? I was a landscaper before this! And a bad one! Why did you put me in charge?!"

Alkram cuts Tyrdeo off and stands before the crowd. "Enough of your crying. Be a man. I faced down Engi war machines and Zoltan peacekeepers in that war, while you were busy trimming hedges! You had your chance, but it's time the Eargen Republic had a competent leader for once!" The crowd joins in, chanting and practically drooling at the mouth for the prospect of killing the former President. In one final effort, Tyrdeo turns to you, pleading. "Please, I know I made mistakes, I know the Coalition is your enemy, but you can't let them do this! I don't want to be president anymore, I never did! I just want to live!"

choice.text: You had your chance. You get what's coming to you.

event.text: Tyrdeo squeals in fear as his fate is sealed. He is cut free and flung into the crowd, where he is torn to shreds by his former disciples. A gruesome end beyond all doubt. Alkram watches in what you assume is disgust. Ironic considering he played the hand of fate there, but perhaps he's envisioning himself in that position if he screws up himself.

With Tyrdeo dead, the remaining Coalition and Inquisition forces flee, leaving only you and the Leeches. Alkram begins to make a speech, "For too long the Republic has been stifled by incompetency. It's time a TRUE leader takes the crown, and I could think of no one better than mysel-" Alkram is cut off by the crowd, who begins to boo again. Seems the Leeches have finally caught onto their situation. Cycles and cycles of the same thing over and over, and they're done with it. Alkram backs down, terrified that he's about to meet the same fate.

"Uh, did I say myself? Sorry, I didn't mean that. What I meant to say was that I think it's time the Republic finally elect a president for the first time since it was founded! But I'm afraid I musn't take part. I've gotten old. It's time I retire. Goodbye." Alkram slithers off the stage over to you. "This has been a disaster. But I've done my part. At least the Republic might finally see better days. Are you in need of a fighter? I have gotten older, but I'm still more than competent."

choice.text: This seems a bit excessive. Maybe he doesn't deserve this?

event.text: Tyrdeo lets out a cheer while the crowd boos your opinion. Gravely, Alkram says, "There is no second chance for a man like this. I've killed for less. In order to succeed on the throne, I must kill this miserable sob. All great revolutions end with the death of a king."

choice.text: Throne? So you're going to be king after him?

event.text: Alkram blinks, realizing his poor choice of words, but it's too late. The crowd takes notice and soon their hostility turns towards him. "You're no better than Tyrdeo! You're just another corrupt, power hungry wannabe trying to seize power through force!" cries one angry bystander, and the rest agree. Soon the mob has swarmed Alkram and things turn bloody. In the chaos, Tyrdeo breaks free and rushes over to you. "I might faint. I haven't been this terrified in all my life. I've soiled myself! Oh wait, sorry, you didn't need to know that. Anyways - please, take me with you! I can do more than trim hedges, I promise!" You agree, but before you can make it back to the ship, Tyrdeo ducks back into his palace and returns with his bird which he loads into the cargo. What a strange, strange man.

You shoot Tyrdeo once in the head, instantly killing him. Moments later, Alkram and his men storm into the room but are shocked to see the president already dead. "W-what? You killed him? Already? What the hell? Your enthusiasm on this has only complicated the process further." Alkram growls, clearly annoyed. "It falls on me now to fix this. Wonderful. I'll have my men give you a reward for this, but don't expect any future favors."

event.name: LEECH_INQUISITIONER
event.text: The bright red hull of an unusual Rock vessel approaches. This is no ordinary Inquisition vessel, but rather a Paladin. The Paladins are rarely seen outside of their home in the Numa V system, so this can't be good.

choice.text: Wait and see what it'll do.

event.text: To your surprise, the ship merely hails instead of opening fire. "I... am Inquisitor Gora. Don't tell me your name... I do not care. I have a proposition for you. I know we are not friends, thankfully... but I believe we could strike a mutually beneficial arrangement..."

"I have been sent here by the Theocracy to.. handle the situation with General Alkram's revolution. Personally I do not... care for the Leeches, but I know better than to question my... leaders. My men have discovered the location of a cache where a prototype vessel is being kept. Destroy it and... the revolutionaries will struggle against my forces. In return, you may take with you any weaponry in the cache that you can carry alongside the blueprints of the cruiser. How does this... sound?"
"Good... good... I will send over the... coordinates immediately." With that, the vessel jumps away.
"Surely you are not planning to go through with this?" Alkram studies you. "...I have a counterproposal, if you will listen."

"If we go there, we can make a feint. My allies will pretend to be destroyed. As the Paladins approach, we will spring an ambush on them, flanking them and rendering the threat they pose non-existent. There will be much scrap, and we will even reward you. Consider it."
"Alkram is right. We have the perfect opportunity to destroy an enemy and cultivate an allegiance. I wholeheartedly throw my support behind this plan."

"This Paladin has foolishly given us the perfect opportunity to destroy them. When we enter their region, I can hail the Revolutionaries, and we can spring a trap. It is a much safer option than attacking them head on. They will regret attempting to control us."
"Then you are a waste of my time... I see no reason to keep you alive any longer."
"Then you are a waste of my time... I see no reason to keep you alive any longer."
There's no point in waiting for the inevitable, you better attack first and attack fast!
The ship seems too slow to follow even if it had noticed you, so you quickly slip away.

event.name: LEECH_INQUISITIONER_CACHE

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Upon arriving at the beacon, the location of the cache is not immediately apparent. The coordinates specify a location not far from here.

choice.text: (Alkram) Hail the revolutionaries to plan an ambush.

event.text: "Comrades! The Theocracy believes that this Renegade will deliver you into the Theocracy's iron fist. However, they have played right into our hands! We will feign victory over you, and lure the Theocracy's forces." The Leeches seems surprised at Alkram's presence, but they are no stranger to guerilla tactics.

choice.text: (Ariadne) Hail the revolutionaries to plan an ambush.

event.text: "I am Admiral Ariadne of the Lost Suns, and I have come with a proposition. The Theocracy knows of this cache, and have sent us to destroy you. However, we are not their puppets. We will help you destroy them if you will assist us in bringing them to ruin." The Leeches recognize the leader of the Lost Suns and after some discussion, agree to assist you.

event.name: APPROACH_REVOLUTIONARY_BASE
event.text: The scenery in front of you forces you to double check the coordinates, but this is definitely the right place. So much for a simple cache - this is an entire base of operations. Sculpted from what was once an abandoned mining colony, the Revolutionaries have set up several large warehouses below.
Get ready for a rough fight - if the Inquisition needs you to take care of it then it must be no ordinary threat.

As you gear up to attack the cache, Alkram approaches you. "You bastard! You would force me to put your cause over my own? Have you no soul?" After a moment of glaring at you, he shakes his head. "I won't forget this." He mutters.
Inquisition be damned, there's no reason to go risking life over limb for some Rockmen who'll probably stab you in the back anyways.

event.name: LEECH_INQUISITIONER_CACHE_WIN
event.text: The prototype vessel has been defeated. This'll probably set back the revolutionaries quite a lot, for better or for worse.

You begin to reach out to Gora but he's already arrived moments after the ship was defeated. "Excellent job... captain. As promised, the blueprints are yours. You have... 3 minutes until we destroy this place to take whatever it is you... want."

choice.text: Grab as many supplies as you can!

event.text: You hurry down to the mining colony and grab as many resources as you can carry and stuff them into your cargo before taking off. Below you, you can see a violent explosion engulf the colony and leave little behind but rubble.

You hurry down to the mining colony and grab one of the weapons and stuff it into your cargo before taking off. Below you, you can see a violent explosion engulf the colony and leave little behind but rubble.

You hurry down to the mining colony and convince an Ampere that was detained by the revolutionaries to join you before taking off. Below you, you can see a violent explosion engulf the colony and leave little behind but rubble.

event.name: REVOLUTIONARY_PALADIN_TRAP
event.text: The Paladin vessel jumps in only a few moments after you signal him. However, it doesn't take long for your deception to be uncovered. "You... I should have expected treachery from Renegade filth! You'll regret this!" The Paladins seem more focused on you than their original target!

choice.text: The Revolutionaries hail you as you prepare for battle.

event.text: "If we can take a closer look at their ship once it's dealt with, it would be of great worth to our cause. We can offer help in one of two ways. We can focus on draining their reactor, or we can provide artillery fire support. Which would you prefer?"
The cruiser falls back and docks with the base. While the base itself has no weapons system, their cruiser's weapon system can be repurposed to function as a make-shift ASB.
The Revolutionary cruiser's weapons withdraw. Like a parasite, the cruiser hovers directly behind the Paladin cruiser, sapping its reactor.

choice.text: [Note: Choosing to use the EMP combat augment in the battle preparation menu will clear the effect of the Leech's reactor drain when it's over.]

event.name: REVOLUTIONARY_PALADIN_VICTORY
event.text: The Paladin ship comes to a rest as you and the Revolutionaries finish it off. Their ship has a bountiful yield, which you help yourself to.

"We must be a threat if even the Theocracy has sent their greatest warriors against us. They have made a grave miscalculation by tipping their hand. We'll give you some standard provisions, the blueprints to our cruiser, and your choice of a weapon or a prisoner."

The Revolutionaries release an Ampere from a cell. The Ampere seems a little disgruntled, but goes along with it. "I don't know who you are or what's going on... but serving on a ship is better than rotting away in a cell."
